content.description: From the same bolted belay for The Truth, head up and right to a bolt. From here follow the right leaning, steep crack to a wide pod section. Either lieback, or offwidth this crux part, and pull the lip. From here, a good rest leads to beautiful 11- fingers and face climbing to the same anchor as for The Truth.
content.protection:
.5 to 2". Heavy on the finger sized pieces.

One bolt.

Bolted bottom and top belays shared with The Truth
content.location: Same approach as for The Truth

content.description:
Fun route, starts on the 3 bolt start to Joe's Garage.

Clip these bolts, 1 or 2 pieces gets you to the top of the block.

From here head up 10 or so more bolts to the anchor on the big ledge (end of Joe's 1st pitch).

Climbing is mostly 11- until 3rd to last bolt.

A V5 Boulder problem to a huge rest, then 12a for the last 2 bolts finishes up this fun juggy route.

80m rope necessary to lower off.
content.location:
Starts on the variation 3 bolt start to Joe's Garage.

Heads left of Joe's Garage up the bolts in the dihedral.

content.description:
An amazing pitch! Technical face and thin crack climbing leads to a sustained lieback and stemming dihedral.

Crux is thin liebacking with high feet at 75'.

Glory crack jugs to the top.

One of the best of it's grade.
content.protection: Lots of pieces in .4 to .75 range. Nuts work well in the many pods. Bolted anchor at 100'
content.location: Climb an approach pitch (40' of Donkey Way, then veer right passing Silverback anchors, and up to a bushy ledge and a 2 bolt anchor at 90') 5.9.

climbs.name: Sixty Forty
climbs.fa: Brian Ketron, Ryan Kelly, Nate Kerr

content.description: Beautiful! 30' of 5.11 fingers leads to some thin, bolted face climbing (crux). Clip more bolts up and left onto a gorgeous blunt arete,  then steep stemming to an anchor at 100'.
content.protection: 30' of finger sized pieces to 11 bolts, to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This route suffers from the fact that it is a 2nd pitch to either First Blood, or Silverback Arete, both of which are much more difficult than Sixty Forty.

The first ascent party accessed this route by climbing The Truth, then lower/swing to the left, to the bottom anchor of Sixty Forty. This is also the top anchor for First Blood and Silverback.

content.description:
Thin, balancy, and powerful arete.

Shares top anchor with First Blood.
content.location:
Climb first half of Donkey Way, and veer right to a bolted belay on right side of Arete.

Approach is bolted 5.9.

climbs.name: The Higher Truth
climbs.fa: Brian Ketron, Matt Benoit, Ryan Kelly Oct, 2018

content.description:
An incredible pitch!

The pitch starts with 20 meters of laybacking and jamming up a 5.10 corner. At about halfway up the pitch, the climbing abruptly becomes much harder with bolts the rest of the way. Clip the first bolt, and pull off the 1st crux; gastons and a series of cross-through underclings.

Take advantage of the calf pumper rest before the steep climbing.

Pull off the next crux through the bulge via barn-door liebacks and big throws to get established on the headwall.

Climb jugs and liebacks up the 92° headwall to a series of slopers, and a pump crux right before the anchor.

Clip the chains as you stand atop the wall!

An 80m rope will lower you back to the belay.
content.protection:
Gear from nuts to #3 Camalot. 8 bolts. 2 bolt anchors.

80m rope required!
content.location:
Climb the access pitch to reach the base of The Truth.

Climb the Truth (12a thin crack).

From the anchor atop The Truth, climb the dihedral to headwall, to the top of the Sugar Cookie

40m pitch!

climbs.name: Grandpa Joe’s Direct
climbs.fa: Ed Barry, Rick Cashner (1979), Brian Ketron

content.description:
Start this route with a 3 bolt variation (11b) which continues up and left into a large flake and to a large pedestal (stance). This variation adds 40 feet of high quality face climbing. Alternatively, there is a 3rd class scramble around the corner to the left.

From the pedestal above the flake, place high gear (nuts and blue alien size) and punch it up to good finger locks (5.11) in a 50 foot splitter finger crack (mostly .4 and .5 Camalot).

Either stop at the anchor or continue past a bolt and through a small roof (11+) and up a crack to another bolted belay.

80m rope required to lower off.
content.protection: Doubles from purple Metolius to #2 Camalot
content.location: From the "Staging area" at the base of the Sugar Cookie, start at the leftmost bolted line (of the three bolted lines) on the wall or scramble up 3rd class to the left to access a pedestal at the start of an obvious finger crack.

content.description:
The dihedral 40' off the ground.

Difficult boulder problems followed by rests, leads to sustained stemming and back stepping, followed by a pumpy arete.
content.location: Climb the first half of Donkey Way to the belay below the perfect corner.

climbs.name: Evil Sede
climbs.fa: Brian Ketron, Schuyler Greenleaf, Ryan Kelly

content.description:
Powerful moves, bad feet and high steps define this route. Two distinct cruxes, the hardest one is in the middle but a second crux guards the chains.

Good rests at bolts. Very beta intensive.
content.location: From the "staging area" this is the middle bolt line (between "Joe's Garage" and "The Donkey Way").

content.description: The warm-up and/or approach pitch. A few big moves and mantles between ledges. Probably wet.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Single set of cams from .3-.75 Camalot.
content.location:
This is the rightmost bolt line and may also be used to access, First Blood, Silverback Arete,

The Truth and Wilde

climbs.name: Chuffed As F*ck (extension to Well Chuffed)

content.description:
A really cool extension to an already unique climb.

From the large ledge after the V5 Crux of Well Chuffed, continue up for 7 more bolts up the double arete.

The crux of this extension lies within the first 3 bolts, and is a V7 boulder problem followed by easier 5.11 to the top.
content.location:
Start as for Well Chuffed/Grandpa's Garage with the 3 bolt 11b to crack to gain the top of the block.

A new anchor here allows one to climb Chuffed AF with a single 80 m.

Climb all but the last bolt of Well Chuffed (12c).

On the big block ledge after the crux, Well Chuffed heads right to the shared anchor of Joe's Garage, Chuffed AF continues straight up the double arete for 7 more bolts.
